adjectives.description: aflutter (comparative more aflutter, superlative most aflutter)

examples: I can hear / Your heart a-flutter over the snow-hills;

entries.meaning: Filled or covered (with something that flutters).
examples: The day being warm and sultry, the balcony was all aflutter with the feather fans of the ladies of the family and their attendants,

entries.meaning: In a state of tremulous excitement, anticipation or confusion.
examples: […]  she rose, all a-flutter within, it is true, but with a face as nearly sedate as the inborn witchery of her eyes would allow.
